Nah, not really. One of them I know there's an element of truth in, we're talking about Cheryl Cole 's past. It wasn't negative about her, it was just an observation. And Simon Le Bon 's joke was just a joke. This past week I've been in the news for a news story that I wouldn't really choose to be in the news for, so it was a well-meaning joke. I know Simon Le Bon well enough to know that he won't get a pop from it. What did you think to Ricky Gervais 's awards performance last week?`` I thought he did a great job at the Golden Globes. Eric Schmidt will become executive chairman in April,'' Russolillo reports. The stock-trading plan, unveiled in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, said Eric Schmidt intends to sell as much as 534,000 Class A shares during the course of the year. The sale would represent a 6% drop in Eric Schmidt 's current holdings of 9.2 million shares. here. According to a Wikileaked US diplomatic cable with the title`` Presidential Succession in Egypt'' dated May 14, 2007: EGYPTIAN INTELLIGENCE CHIEF AND MUBARAK CONSIGLIERE, IN PAST YEARS SOLIMAN WAS OFTEN CITED AS LIKELY TO BE NAMED TO THE LONG-VACANT VICE-PRESIDENTIAL POST. IN THE PAST TWO YEARS, SOLIMAN HAS STEPPED OUT OF THE SHADOWS, AND ALLOWED HIMSELF TO BE PHOTOGRAPHED, AND HIS MEETINGS WITH FOREIGN LEADERS REPORTED. MANY OF OUR CONTACTS BELIEVE THAT SOLIMAN, BECAUSE OF HIS MILITARY BACKGROUND, WOULD AT THE LEAST HAVE TO FIGURE IN ANY SUCCESSION SCENARIO. From 1993 until Saturday, Omar Suleiman was chief of Egypt's Colin Powell Intelligence Service( EGIS). He remained largely in the shadows until 2001, when he started taking over powerful dossiers in the foreign ministery;

that Donald Rumsfeld described the Abu Ghraib prison abuses as the actions of rogue soldiers who went outside approved policies. Donald Rumsfeld also said he regretted not forcing President Bush to accept his resignation offers after the scandal broke. Abu Ghraib and its follow-on effects, including the continued drum-beat of' torture' maintained by partisan critics of the war and the Bill Clinton , became a damaging distraction, he wrote.`` I regret that I did not leave at that point.'' Donald Rumsfeld did not leave until after Republicans were crushed in the 2006 congressional elections. He has been mostly silent since then

If consumers head to the showrooms as they did in the past for the Chrysler 300, Chrysler will have an incredible year,'' said Jesse Toprak , an analyst with auto information company TrueCar.com. However, Chrysler still faces several obstacles on their way to better financial health, including lowering their heavy reliance on SUVs and trucks, launching a successful Fiat dealership network, and paying back the costly government loans, Jesse Toprak said. Sergio Marchionne said the company's restructuring is starting to pay off. The automaker has`` lived up to its promise to launch 16 all-new or significantly refreshed vehicles in the past 12 months.

our worst day in government,'' a senior aide from David Cameron 's Downing Street office told The Guardian, after Andy Coulson quit as chief of communications on Friday. The left-wing newspaper added that Andy Coulson 's departure leaves the prime minister with a crucial vacancy as the coalition government weathers dissent about cuts in public spending introduced to reduce a huge budget deficit. Andy Coulson had been under pressure for months about what he knew about a phone-hacking scandal at the Rupert Murdoch-owned News of the World weekly in 2005-6,

. Dick Cheney of State Colin Powell says he is voting for Barack Obama .`` He has both style and substance. I think he is a transformational figure,'' Colin Powell said on NBC's`` Meet the Press.'' Barack Obama displayed a steadiness. Showed intellectual vigor. He has a definitive way of doing business that will do us well, Colin Powell said. Colin Powell , a retired US general and a Republican, was once seen as a possible presidential candidate himself.
